page.title: 11Local News (June 1985)
page.content:
A young Alsation puppy was left to die in a deserted area of wasteland in Camp Hill.The puppy was rescued around midnight by residents of Willow Road after they heard it crying.
More than 50 energetic 'fun runners' from the Griffin Inn have been pounding the pavement to earn money for charity.They raised Â£256.
An opportunist thief stole Â£150 kept in a jar at a house in Hillcrest Road.The occupier was working in the garden at the time.
A new step is being taken in a bid to reduce accidents at the A5 / Watling Street junction with Higham Lane.A roundabout is to be built to slow down traffic.
